intro: Clerodendrum cyrtophyllum var. cyrtophyllum, commonly known as the white-flowered clerodendrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a mild aromatic scent. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their aesthetic appeal.
